bill.title: An Act To Amend Title 11 Of The Delaware Code Relating To The Fund To Combat Violent Crime, Funded By An Additional Penalty Imposed By Courts For Various Offenses.
bill.description: SYNOPSIS To provide state and local law enforcement agencies with additional resources to fight violent crime, including gun violence, this legislation establishes The Fund to Combat Violent Crimes. The Fund will be funded by an additional penalty of $15 to be levied upon individuals convicted of crimes or offenses, thus ensuring that violators bear the cost of this initiative. The first $2.25 million of the Fund will go to the Department of Safety and Homeland Security to fight violent crime. The next $1 million will be administered by The Fund to Combat Violent Crimes Committee and distributed to local law enforcement agencies in connection with initiatives to reduce violent crime, especially gun violence. Local police agencies will apply for such funds. The next $1 million will be distributed to local law enforcement agencies. Any monies received in excess of $4.25 million per year will be deposited in the General Fund.
